page.title: 09WEST LODGE NEAR STUBHAMPTON
page.content: West Lodge is the site of one of the ancient lodges of the Royal hunting grounds of Cranborne Chase. The original lodge was known to have existed at the end of the 16th century but nothing seen above the ground today is likely to be of so early a date. The present building is of the first half of the 18th century with early 19th century single-storey wings. It is believed that John Pitt, a distant cousin of William Pitt the Elder, was responsible for many of the architectural niceties found at the Lodge. The central pavilion of the south front with its full Tuscan portico has many of the features found at Blenheim Palace. One of the last Royalty to hunt in the grounds was Edward VII.
